definition: feeling of guilt
guilt/crime/fault/blame/sin
evil/fierce/vicious/ugly/coarse/to harm
see 惡心|恶心[e3 xin1]
to hate/to loathe/ashamed/to fear/to slander
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~

sentences.english: The son overthrew father, but he would be repenting forever and crime sense followed the son.
sentences.chinese: 兒子推翻父親，但伴隨兒子的將是永遠懺悔和罪惡感。

sentences.english: How to get rid of the guilt feeling?
So perhaps guilt is good after all.
sentences.chinese: 歸根到底，也許罪惡感是個好東西。

sentences.english: Guilt is not a Godly place to be.
sentences.chinese: 罪惡感並不代表敬神與虔誠。

sentences.english: Heed your hunger pangs, but forget the guilt.
sentences.chinese: 關注了飢餓感卻忽視了罪惡感。

sentences.english: We give to alleviate guilt and repair our self-image.
sentences.chinese: 爲了減輕罪惡感和重修自我形象而付出。

sentences.english: And that, I believe, is what true redemption is, Amir jan, when guilt leads to good.
sentences.chinese: 而真正的贖罪是從罪惡感中走向良善。

sentences.english: Sinburning is also a monthly ceremony where your anonymous confession is annihilated by fire.
sentences.chinese: 罪惡感的消除也將是一個你每月浴火重生的典禮。

sentences.english: This is akin to a robotic model of guilt, Arkin says.
sentences.chinese: Arkin說，這好比一個有罪惡感的機器人模型。

sentences.english: When we hurt, through guilt; it reminds us not to do that bad thing again.
sentences.chinese: 傷害他人時產生的罪惡感提醒我們不要再幹壞事了。

sentences.english: He may have hung himself, tormented by guilt, as reported in Matthew.
sentences.chinese: 馬太福音中說他深受罪惡感折磨而上吊自殺。

sentences.english: It drains your energy, fosters guilt, and saps your self-esteem.
sentences.chinese: 你的精力耗竭，自尊心削弱，罪惡感加重。

sentences.english: The sin and the guilt have become part of you.
sentences.chinese: 罪惡感已經成爲你的一部分了。

sentences.english: If you say no, you feel a tinge of guilt.
sentences.chinese: 如果你對他們說“不”，你會覺得有點罪惡感。

sentences.english: It’s guilt-free eating, which is ultimately more pleasurable.
sentences.chinese: 這樣喫起來沒有罪惡感，最終更令人享受。

definition: crime/evil/sin
no cause, no reason (idiom); completely uncalled for
to abandon oneself to despair/to give up and stop bothering
guilty conscience/to feel a twinge of guilt
feeling of powerlessness/sense of helplessness
original identity fully revealed (idiom); fig. to unmask and expose the whole truth
ashamed and unable to show one's face
to blush with shame (literary)
to fall short of/to have a deficit/deficit/deficiency
dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
grievance/resentment/complaint
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

definition: every hope turns to dust (idiom); completely disheartened
should not/to owe nothing
to have nothing to say (idiom)
